qas.question: Colloquial stratum can be traced to several strata in what lexicon?
The earliest colloquial stratum can be traced to what?
When were the Southern and Northern Dynasties?
In what era did the earliest divergence between literary pronunciations begin?

plausible_answers.text: the period of the Southern and Northern Dynasties (420 - 589 CE)

qas.question: When did the second prestige dialect appear?
During the Tang Dynasty, in what year did the earliest stratum appear?
What lexicon can the prestige dialect be traced to?
What period does the earliest Min Lexicon come from?

context: The pronounced divergence between literary and colloquial pronunciations found in Hokkien dialects is attributed to the presence of several strata in the <a0_0><b8_0>Min<a0_0/> lexicon<b8_0/>. The earliest, colloquial stratum is traced to <b5_0><b9_0>the <a1_0>Han dynasty<a1_0/> (<a2_0>206 BCE - 220 CE<b5_0/><a2_0/>)<b9_0/>; the second colloquial one comes from <b6_0>the period of the Southern and Northern Dynasties (<a3_0>420 - 589 CE<a3_0/>)<b6_0/>; the third stratum of pronunciations (typically literary ones) comes from the Tang Dynasty (<a4_0><b7_0>618–907 CE<b7_0/><a4_0/>) and is based on the prestige dialect of Chang'an (modern day Xi'an), its capital.
